section.section: In this section, "sewer cleaning" means the cleaning or clearing of and the removal of stoppages or obstructions in sanitary sewer lines, pipes, and fixtures.
"Sewer cleaning" does not include any installation, maintenance, extension, removal, or alteration of any pipe, sanitary fixture, or other sewer apparatus.

text.section:
This section may not be construed to:
require a person to have a sewer cleaner's license to clean a sewer on the person's own property;
prevent a person from cleaning a sewer on the person's own property; or
apply to or prohibit the cleaning by any person of a sewer or sanitary fixture of any dwelling, commercial or industrial establishment, or premises owned or operated by the person.
The Commission shall adopt and enforce regulations governing sewer cleaning in sanitary sewer lines, pipes, and fixtures connected to the Commission's sanitary sewer system.

section.section: To qualify for a sewer cleaner's license, a person need not be a master plumber.
A sewer cleaner's license does not authorize the licensee to engage in the plumbing business other than sewer cleaning.
